Trying to use the event app that was shown in the AMA last week, but keep getting this message - _The post to “add secret” in portal 7123610 was forbidden. This app hasn’t been granted all required scopes to make this call. Read more about required scopes here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/scopes>._

Have tried in a sandbox account and an account with growth suit enterprice and CMS - any advice?

Hi all. I'm new to HS and new to the command line too so I'm being extra cautious here. I'm experimenting with a sandbox account. I've got the CMS CLI set up, boilerplate downloaded. I now want to set up the watch command to sync my local environment with my sandbox account. In the documentation the watch command is listed as:
```hs watch --portal=<name> <src> <dest>```
My question - which is presumably something I've just skimmed over and now can't find - is where do I get the <name> for --portal=<name>? After that I think I understand the rest: <src> in my case will be 'test-theme/src' and <dest> will be 'test-theme'.
you can use the portal id in <name> I believe
I should clarify - what I actually need to know is what the portal even is. :smile:

Ok never mind. I've realised specifying a portal is optional. If anyone see this thread and can tell me what the portal is for and where to find its details that would be great. For now, I've simply not specified a portal and run `hs watch <src> <dest>`  as is instead. In my case my <src> locally is 'test-theme/src' and my <dest> in HubSpot is 'test-theme'.
And now my theme files are being watched and uploaded on save, which is just what I wanted.
Hey Dan, are you using a personal CMS access key to authenticate your local development environment?

Hi all, sorry I need to ask again. I was not able to see the solution for this issue in the channel. I get the following error when I try to upload a serverless project over the portal. Any suggestions?
`[ERROR] Uploading file "\Desktop\serverless\serverless-tutorial\myfunction.functions\congratulation.js" to "serverless-tutorial/myfunction.functions/congratulation.js" failed`
`[ERROR] Folder name cannot end with .functions`
I'll give you a hand. Going to DM to collect some more information.
<@USRE524EA> — when you get it figured out, post to the forums so people can easily surface it!  <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/bd-p/designers_support?label=Local%20Development>
The issue here is that developer test accounts do not include CMS Hub Enterprise, so either a CMS sandbox account needs to be created/used or a CMS Hub Enterprise trial started.

Hey <@UD53A9UUR>,

It is simply because of the developer account type that I have.
I understand from Gregory's help that developer test accounts have not been unified.

Creating a fresh dev. account via <https://offers.HubSpot.com/free-cms-developer-sandbox> did the trick.
We'll also work to improve the error messaging to make that clearer.
That would really help for the ones who will try with their current dev. accounts like I did. Thanks again <@U22VBL87M>!

Thanks <@UGDF9EBPW>! I have a similar setup, the hs watch *should* be watching my dist directory and it certainly seems like the gulp process finishes prior to the HubSpot upload, but sometimes when I refresh my front end, the sheet seems busted. I may have wrongly assumed that the sheet was being uploaded before gulp. I suppose HubSpot needs to compile the sheet after the upload, so it's possible that I'm simply being impatient there. I'll have to oberve it more. Thanks again for taking the time to write!
HubSpot cache is a ****. Always using a preview link instead of a live webpage should help. Might not be the issue tho.
